content:
What’s this? This is a jump pad used to navigate to the document interface. On the computer, you can see the document’s table of contents on the left side. On mobile, you can click the button in the upper right corner to see the document’s table of contents. The documents on this site are written in both Chinese and English; for ease of reading, subsequent documents will be placed separately.

summary:
What’s this?

  • This is a jump pad used to navigate to the document interface.
  • On the computer, you can see the document’s table of contents on the left side.
  • On mobile, you can click the button in the upper right corner to see the document’s table of contents.

The documents on this site are written in both Chinese and English; for ease of reading, subsequent documents will be placed separately.
title: Description - è§£é‡Š

content:
GitHub: gitAuto
ä¸­æ–‡ç‰ˆæœ¬README
gitAuto gitAuto is a Lightweight Git Auto-Commit / Push Tool (Windows only)
designed to automatically execute the Pull â†’ Wait â†’ Countdown â†’ Commit â†’ Push workflow when local files change.
Its goal is not to replace Git, but to reduce repetitive, low-value Git operations.
âœ¨ Features ğŸš€ Auto Mode: Detects file changes, counts down, and automatically pushes âš¡ Manual Mode: One command to commit & push immediately ğŸ”„ Automatic Retry on Push Failure (with interactive confirmation) ğŸ”• Quiet Mode: Reduces Git output while keeping runtime status visible ğŸ§  Smart Initialization: Guides repository setup on first use ğŸ§© Auto-Generated Config File (located in .git/) ğŸªŸ Windows Only (uses Win32 API) ğŸš€ Usage View Help gitautoInitialize Repository (First-Time Setup) gitauto initBehavior:
If the current directory is not a Git repository, it initializes one If it’s the first commit, it will guide you to enter the remote repository URL Automatically generates: .git/gitauto.conf .gitignore (with a gitAuto managed section) Manual Push (Commit Immediately) gitauto -MEquivalent to:
git add . git commit git pushAuto-Push Mode gitauto -AWorkflow:
Starts with a git pull Enters waiting state Detects file changes Begins countdown (configurable) Automatically commits & pushes after countdown Returns to waiting state Quiet Mode gitauto -A --quietSuppresses native Git output Retains gitAuto status messages Suitable for long-term background operation âš™ï¸ Configuration File Configuration file location:
.git/gitauto.confExample content:
# gitAuto config countdown=5 # Auto-push countdown (seconds) watch_whitelist=src/,include/ # Whitelist of folders to watch for changes watch_blacklist=.git/,build/ # Blacklist of folders to ignoreConfiguration file is auto-generated if missing
Changes take effect immediately; no restart required
ğŸ“ .gitignore Management Strategy gitAuto maintains a dedicated block within .gitignore:
# >>> gitAuto /build/ # <<< gitAutoNotes:
Will not write duplicate entries Does not interfere with your existing ignore rules Only modifies this block during reset operations âš ï¸ Output & Prompt Legend [ERROR]: Red, high-risk errors (e.g., not a repo, push failure) [WARN]: Yellow, warnings that do not interrupt the workflow [gitAuto]: Tool’s own status output [git]: Git output (can be hidden in quiet mode) ğŸ“œ License MIT License
gitAuto gitAuto æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ª è½»é‡çº§ Git è‡ªåŠ¨æäº¤ / æ¨é€å·¥å…·ï¼ˆWindows onlyï¼‰ï¼Œ
ç”¨äºåœ¨æœ¬åœ°æ–‡ä»¶å‘ç”Ÿå˜åŠ¨æ—¶ï¼Œè‡ªåŠ¨å®Œæˆ æ‹‰å– â†’ ç­‰å¾… â†’ è®¡æ—¶ â†’ æäº¤ â†’ æ¨é€ çš„æµç¨‹ã€‚
å®ƒçš„ç›®æ ‡ä¸æ˜¯å–ä»£ Gitï¼Œè€Œæ˜¯å‡å°‘é‡å¤ã€ä½ä»·å€¼çš„ Git æ“ä½œã€‚
âœ¨ ç‰¹æ€§ ğŸš€ è‡ªåŠ¨æ¨¡å¼ï¼šæ£€æµ‹æ–‡ä»¶å˜åŠ¨ï¼Œå€’è®¡æ—¶åè‡ªåŠ¨ push âš¡ æ‰‹åŠ¨æ¨¡å¼ï¼šä¸€æ¡å‘½ä»¤ç«‹å³ commit & push ğŸ”„ Push å¤±è´¥è‡ªåŠ¨é‡è¯•ï¼ˆå¯äº¤äº’ç¡®è®¤ï¼‰ ğŸ”• Quiet æ¨¡å¼ï¼šå‡å°‘ git è¾“å‡ºï¼Œä½†ä¿ç•™è¿è¡ŒçŠ¶æ€ ğŸ§  æ™ºèƒ½åˆå§‹åŒ–ï¼šé¦–æ¬¡ä½¿ç”¨å¯å¼•å¯¼é…ç½®ä»“åº“ ğŸ§© é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶è‡ªåŠ¨ç”Ÿæˆï¼ˆä½äº .git/ï¼‰ ğŸªŸ ä»…æ”¯æŒ Windowsï¼ˆä½¿ç”¨ Win32 APIï¼‰ ğŸš€ ä½¿ç”¨æ–¹æ³• æŸ¥çœ‹ä½¿ç”¨è¯´æ˜ gitautoåˆå§‹åŒ–ä»“åº“ï¼ˆé¦–æ¬¡ä½¿ç”¨ï¼‰ gitauto initè¡Œä¸ºè¯´æ˜ï¼š
è‹¥å½“å‰ç›®å½•ä¸æ˜¯ Git ä»“åº“ï¼Œä¼šè¿›è¡Œåˆå§‹åŒ– è‹¥æ˜¯é¦–æ¬¡ commitï¼Œä¼šå¼•å¯¼ä½ è¾“å…¥è¿œç¨‹ä»“åº“ URL ä¼šè‡ªåŠ¨ç”Ÿæˆï¼š .git/gitauto.conf .gitignoreï¼ˆåŒ…å« gitAuto ç®¡ç†åŒºå—ï¼‰ æ‰‹åŠ¨æ¨é€ï¼ˆç«‹å³æäº¤ï¼‰ gitauto -Mç­‰ä»·äºï¼š
git add . git commit git pushè‡ªåŠ¨æ¨é€æ¨¡å¼ gitauto -Aæµç¨‹ï¼š
å¯åŠ¨æ—¶å…ˆæ‰§è¡Œä¸€æ¬¡ git pull è¿›å…¥ç­‰å¾…æ€ æ£€æµ‹åˆ°æ–‡ä»¶å˜åŠ¨ å¼€å§‹å€’è®¡æ—¶ï¼ˆå¯é…ç½®ï¼‰ å€’è®¡æ—¶ç»“æŸåè‡ªåŠ¨ commit & push è¿”å›ç­‰å¾…æ€ Quiet æ¨¡å¼ gitauto -A --quietæŠ‘åˆ¶ Git åŸç”Ÿè¾“å‡º ä¿ç•™ gitAuto çŠ¶æ€ä¿¡æ¯ é€‚åˆé•¿æ—¶é—´åå°è¿è¡Œ âš™ï¸ é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ä½ç½®ï¼š
.git/gitauto.confç¤ºä¾‹å†…å®¹ï¼š
# gitAuto config countdown=5 # è‡ªåŠ¨æ¨é€å€’è®¡æ—¶ï¼ˆç§’ï¼‰ watch_whitelist=src/,include/ # æ£€æµ‹å˜åŠ¨æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹ç™½åå• watch_blacklist=.git/,build/ # æ£€æµ‹å˜åŠ¨æ–‡ä»¶å¤¹é»‘åå•é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ä¸å­˜åœ¨æ—¶ä¼šè‡ªåŠ¨ç”Ÿæˆ
ä¿®æ”¹åæ— éœ€é‡å¯ gitAuto
ğŸ“ .gitignore ç®¡ç†ç­–ç•¥ gitAuto ä¼šåœ¨ .gitignore ä¸­ç»´æŠ¤ä¸€ä¸ªç‹¬ç«‹åŒºå—ï¼š
# >>> gitAuto /build/ # <<< gitAutoè¯´æ˜ï¼š
ä¸ä¼šé‡å¤å†™å…¥ ä¸å½±å“ä½ å·²æœ‰çš„ ignore è§„åˆ™ é‡ç½®æ—¶åªæ“ä½œè¯¥åŒºå— âš ï¸ è¾“å‡ºä¸æç¤ºè¯´æ˜ [ERROR]ï¼šçº¢è‰²ï¼Œé«˜é£é™©é”™è¯¯ï¼ˆå¦‚éä»“åº“ã€push å¤±è´¥ï¼‰ [WARN]ï¼šé»„è‰²ï¼Œè­¦å‘Šä½†ä¸ä¸­æ–­æµç¨‹ [gitAuto]ï¼šå·¥å…·è‡ªèº«çŠ¶æ€è¾“å‡º [git]ï¼šGit è¾“å‡ºï¼ˆå¯åœ¨ quiet æ¨¡å¼ä¸‹éšè—ï¼‰ ğŸ“œ License MIT License

title: Contact Me / è”ç³»æˆ‘

content:
1. Introduction This website is a personal, non-commercial website built using Hugo & Doks. We respect your privacy and are committed to protecting it.
This Privacy Policy explains what information is (or is not) collected when you visit this website.
2. Information We Collect We do not actively collect any personal information from visitors.
Specifically:
No user accounts or login systems No contact forms or submission forms No comment systems No analytics tools (Google Analytics, Plausible, Umami, etc.) No AI services or API integrations The website is purely for content display.
3. Log Data Like most websites, basic server log data may be automatically collected by the hosting provider (e.g. GitHub Pages), which may include:
IP address Browser type Operating system Date and time of access This data is controlled by the hosting provider and is not accessed, analyzed, or stored by the website owner.
4. Cookies This website does not use cookies.
However, the hosting platform or content delivery network (such as GitHub or GitHub Pages) may use essential cookies required for basic website functionality.
5. Third-Party Services This website does not intentionally use any third-party tracking or data collection services.
Content is hosted via:
GitHub Pages Please refer to GitHub’s Privacy Policy for details on how they handle data.
6. Data Security Since no personal data is collected, stored, or processed by this website, there is no risk of personal data leakage from the website itself.
7. Your Rights Depending on your jurisdiction, you may have rights under privacy laws such as GDPR.
As this website does not collect personal data, these rights generally do not apply in practice.
8. Changes to This Policy This Privacy Policy may be updated if the website’s functionality changes. Updates will be reflected on this page.
9. Contact If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, you may contact:
